claims: New Zealand gave women the right to vote in 1893

state.response: نیوزی لینڈ نے 1893 میں خواتین کو ووٹ دینے کا حق دیا
claims: New Zealand gave women the right to vote in 1893

New Zealand gave women the right to vote: When did New Zealand give women the right to vote? New Zealand women's suffrage 1893

On 19 September 1893 the governor, Lord Glasgow, signed a new Electoral Act into law. As a result of this landmark legislation, New Zealand became the first self-governing country in the world in which women had the right to vote in parliamentary elections.
When did New Zealand give women the right to vote? New Zealand women's suffrage 1893

Page 1 – Introduction. On 19 September 1893 the governor, Lord Glasgow, signed a new Electoral Act into law. As a result of this landmark legislation, New Zealand became the first self-governing country in the world in which women had the right to vote in parliamentary elections.
